get.description: Sales orders are used to represent the sale of goods or services to a customer. They are central to a business and define the terms (price, quantity and times) by which the products or services will be delivered.

200.description: The details of the sales orders have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

post.description:
Sales orders are used to represent the sale of goods or services to a customer. They are central to a business and define the terms (price, quantity and times) by which the products or services will be delivered.

Note: Adding traceable items to sales orders.
If you're using traceable stock items and an item is set to be sold from a single batch, then the order quantity must be less than or equal to quantity in the batch. If you try to order more than quantity in the batch, the order cannot be posted via the API.

200.description: The sales order was created. Response body will include the sales order details.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

x-sage-changelog.title: New Override field
x-sage-changelog.description:
Two new fields have been added to the Sales Order Line contract:
  • unit_discount_percent
  • unit_discount_value
These fields allow you to override the default order line discount. Setting one value will automatically calculate the other. If you set both values, then the unit_discount_value will override the unit_discount_percent, recalculating the percent based on the value (and vice-versa). The use of these fields adheres to user permission restrictions. If a user without sufficient permission attempts to override an order line discount, the response returned will be a 401 Unauthorized.

get.summary: Sales Order Lines Available For Despatch.
get.description:
The confirm despatch records the despatch of goods and services from sales order lines to your customers.

A GET request will return a collection of sales order lines available to despatch and can be filtered on the following fields: confirmation_intent_type, trader_id, warehouse_id, document_no and document_date.

In Sage 200 Professional the confirmation_intent_type can be included in the query filter to determine if you are despatching goods (ConfirmOnDespatch) or services (Confirm). If omitted from the query filter, this value will default to ConfirmOnDespatch and return locked sales order goods to despatch.

200.description: The details of the sales order lines that require despatch have been successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

post.summary: Sales Order Lines Available For Despatch.

The confirm despatch records the despatch of goods and services from sales order lines to your customers.

A GET request will return a collection of sales order lines available to despatch and can be filtered on the following fields: confirmation_intent_type, trader_id, warehouse_id, document_no and document_date.

In Sage 200 Professional the confirmation_intent_type can be included in the query filter to determine if you are despatching goods (ConfirmOnDespatch) or services (Confirm). If omitted from the query filter, this value will default to ConfirmOnDespatch and return locked sales order goods to despatch.

requestBody.description: Details of the sales order line you wish to despatch.

get.description: The SOP Settings are used to choose how to process and manage your Sales Order Processing.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Unique Id of the SOP settings.

200.description: Details of SOP settings successfully returned.

400.description: There was a problem with the request. Request body will include details.

is_draft.description: Whether it is a draft order.

is_editing.description: If this is set to true, and the order is still a draft order, the order will remain as a draft order, otherwise the order is made a confirmed order.

is_to_sequence_lines.description: If this is set to true, then the order of the line objects in the lines collection will determine the line number (print sequence number) for each line.

override_on_hold.description: Allows a user that has the permissions to override the order's On Hold status, applied when a customer's account balance is over its credit limit.

recalculate_prices.description: Allows recalculation of the prices for the order when the exchange rate has changed.

apply_available_document_discount_percen.description: This should be passed within the PUT or POST operation to apply the 'available_document_discount_percent' to the sales order only if the 'available_document_discount_percent' is greater than a positive 'document_discount_percent'.

lock_id.description: The lock Id of the sales order when passing the 'is_to_lock' expand to the GET operation. This should be passed back within the PUT operation and 'is_editing' is false to remove the lock against the sales order.

customer_delivery_address_id.description: The Id of the customer delivery address to copy details to the sales order delivery address and resets 'use_invoice_address'.

suppress_warnings.description: If this is set to true, we will suppress warnings specifically for payment with order and this is also the case if 'is_editing' is false.

document_no.description:
Sales order document number.

Note: If the SOP setting in Sage 200 Professional is to NOT automatically generate numbers, then this property MUST be set.
If the SOP setting in Sage 200 Professional is to automatically generate numbers, or you are using Sage 200 Standard (which doesn't allow you to set this option), then setting this on POST will be ignored.

subtotal_goods_value.description: Goods value (sum of stock items and free text).

Multiple memos can be added to each sales order. The user that created the memo, the date it was created and last updated date and time are also recorded.

sop_order.description:
Sales orders are used to represent the sale of goods or services to a customer. They are central to a business and define the terms (price, quantity and times) by which the products or services will be delivered.

Note: Adding traceable items to sales orders.
If you're using traceable stock items and an item is set to be sold from a single batch, then the order quantity must be less than or equal to quantity in the batch. If you try to order more than the quantity in the batch, the order cannot be posted via the API.

Please note that as each line is updated independently, as part of a PUT request, a failed line will return an error in the API response body, however, all lines prior to this will be updated. Subsequent lines to the error will not be posted.

The SOP customer type, used to determine the type of account for orders, quotes and proformas.

The API endpoint returns the following values: EnumCustomerTypeCash, EnumCustomerTypeCredit, EnumCustomerTypeProspect.

Returns a list of sales orders ready for despatch.

This endpoint only supports filtering on the following fields: confirmation_intent_type, trader_id, warehouse_id, document_no and document_date.

sop_user_permission.description:
User permissions allow individual user access to certain parts of a sales order or invoice. Default warehouses can also be set for each different order or invoice entry type.

Note: the Id parameter expects the user Id as specified in System Administration.

sop_confirm_despatch_adjustment.description:
The confirm despatch records the despatch of goods and services from sales order lines to your customers.

A GET request will return a collection of sales order lines available to despatch and can be filtered on the following fields: confirmation_intent_type, trader_id, warehouse_id, document_no and document_date.

In Sage 200 Professional the confirmation_intent_type can be included in the query filter to determine if you are despatching goods (ConfirmOnDespatch) or services (Confirm). If omitted from the query filter, this value will default to ConfirmOnDespatch and return locked sales order goods to despatch.

sop_additional_charge.description:
Additional charges can be added to sales orders to account for items such as carriage and insurance. Within the Sage 200 application, users can setup and maintain the list of additional charges that can be referenced when creating a sales order.

This API resource can be used to determine what each additional charge is for.

sop_order_line_view.description:
When making larger requests for sales order information, the Sales Order Line Views resource is a faster alternative to the 'Sales Orders' resource. The Sales Order Line Views resource returns more information than the 'Sales Orders' resource, and therefore reduces the number of API requests required to return the same information from multiple resources.

This resource returns a view of sales orders, sales order lines, customers, products, warehouses, tax codes and currencies that can be queried on any field. The default sort (orderby) field are by 'sop_order_id' and 'sop_order_line_id' descending.

sop_document_status_type.description:
There are a variety of documents that are used within the Sales Ledger, each with a different status type. These document status types are a pre-defined list, and are common across every instance of Sage 200.

The API endpoint returns details of the document status types that can be used when reading/writing SOP documents.

sop_invoice_credit_type.description:
There are a variety of documents that are used within the Sales Ledger, each with a different type. These document types are a pre-defined list, and are common across every instance of Sage 200.

The API endpoint returns details of the SOP invoice credit types that can be used when reading SOP invoice credit documents.

sop_document_print_status_type.description: Document print status type. These status types are a pre-defined list, and are common across every instance of Sage 200.

sop_order_payment_type.description: This is used to indicate whether the payment on a sales order is a full or part payment.

sop_intrastat_status_type.description: Intrastat status type. These status types are a pre-defined list, and are common across every instance of Sage 200.

sop_document_process_status_type.description: Document process status type. These status types are a pre-defined list, and are common across every instance of Sage 200. They are used for various status including allocated, despatch receipt and cancelled.

sop_back_to_back_status_type.description:
This specifies whether a POP order is required, generated or fulfilled.

The API endpoint returns details of the auto generate option types that can be used.

card_processing_method.description: Indicates whether the payment method is used for payments taken using the Online Card Provider.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

sop_payment_method.description:
SOP Payment methods are used to specify the Sage 200 bank account that a payment is posted to and, to describe the payment used.

The API endpoint returns details of the payment methods that can be used when receiving payments with sales orders.

sop_show_on_picking_list_type.description:
The picking list report can be printed to support the sales order despatch process. Each item on the picking list can be set to 'show', 'hide' or 'exclude' from the picking list.

The API endpoint returns details of the display options for picking list items.

auto_generate_order_return_numbers.description: Indicates whether to automatically generate order and return numbers.

show_order_number_on_confirm.description: Indicates whether to show the order number each time an order or return is saved.

order_line_item_type.description: Indicates whether entry of standard, free text or both line types are allowed.

amend_analysis_codes.description: Indicates whether analysis codes can be changed on an order or return line.

amend_nominal_codes.description: Indicates whether nominal codes can be changed on an order or return line.

allow_payment_with_order.description: Indicates whether to allow payments to be recorded during invoice and full order entry.

user_logon_as_order_taker.description: Indicates whether to use the current user's logon name as the order or return taker.

revenue_nominal_account_same_as.description: Indicates whether to use the same nominal account as the stock item revenue account (true) or the customer account (false).

use_same_cost_centre_department_as_custo.description: Indicates whether the revenue nominal account should use the same cost centre and department as the customer account.

use_same_cost_centre_department_for_issu.description: Indicates whether the stock issues nominal account should use the same cost centre and department as the revenue account.

use_same_cost_centre_department_for_asse.description: Indicates whether the assets of stock nominal account should use the same cost centre and department as the revenue account.

allow_cash_orders.description: Indicates whether a cash account can be specified for an order.

cash_order_account_id.description: The customer Id for the specified cash account.

are_prices_tax_inclusive.description: Indicates whether prices are tax inclusive.

allocate_stock_on_order_entry.description: Indicates whether stock can be allocated on order entry.

update_stock_on_despatch.description: Indicates whether the stock levels should be updated when the goods are despatched (true) or when the invoice is posted (false).

record_cancelled_order_lines.description: Indicates whether to keep a record of cancelled orders for future analysis. For sales orders, this also allows the option of recording cancelled lines when individual items are removed or an item quantity is reduced.

print_picking_lists.description: Indicates whether picking list printing is enabled.

auto_print_picking_lists.description: Indicates whether to automatically print picking lists as part of order entry allocation or not.

add_invoice_credit_note_to_sales_ledger.description: Indicates whether to post invoices and credit notes to the customer accounts straight away or to post to the pending posting file.

print_order_acknowledgements.description: Indicates whether to print acknowledgements for orders.

print_despatch_notes.description: Indicates whether to automatically print a despatch note when an order despatch is confirmed.

fully_paid_invoice_text.description: The text to print on invoices that have been paid in full.

generate_intrastat_entries.description: Indicates whether to generate intrastat entries for orders and returns.

nature_of_transaction_code_id.description: The nature of transaction code Id.

orders_returns_last_archived_up_to.description: The date that orders were last archived up to.

last_archive_run_by.description: The user that ran the last archive process.

last_archive_run_on.description: The date the last archive process was run.

print_traceable_numbers_on_picking_lists.description: Indicates whether to print batch and serial numbers on picking lists.

print_traceable_numbers_on_order_acknowl.description: Indicates whether to print batch and serial numbers on order acknowledgements.

print_traceable_numbers_on_despatch_note.description: Indicates whether to print batch and serial numbers on despatch notes.

print_traceable_numbers_on_invoices.description: Indicates whether to print batch and serial numbers on invoices.

last_purge_archive_run_by.description: The user that ran the last purge process.

last_purge_archive_run_on.description: The date the purge process was last run.

archive_last_purged_up_to.description: The date that orders were last purged to.

allow_amend_picking_lists.description: Indicates whether picking lists can be amended.

default_free_text_confirm_intent_type.description: The default confirmation type for free text lines.

default_service_labour_confirm_intent_ty.description: The default confirmation type for standard item lines with a service or labour stock item.

show_unallocated_items_on_picking_list.description: Indicates whether to show unallocated items on picking lists.

show_undespatched_items_on_despatch_note.description: Indicates whether to show items that are not despatched or allocated on despatch notes.

allow_prospect_quotes.description: Indicates whether quotations and pro formas can be entered using a customer prospect account.

prospect_quote_account_id.description: The customer Id for the specified prospect account.

use_invoice_date_on_stock_history.description: If stock levels are updated when the invoice is posted, this indicates whether to use the invoice date (true) or the despatch date (false) on stock the stock movement transaction.

include_terms_of_delivery_on_intrastat.description: Indicates whether to include terms of delivery on the intrastat entry.

include_statistical_value_on_intrastat.description: Indicates whether to include statistical values on the intrasat entry (Irish companies only).

intrastat_date_type.description: Indicates whether the intrastat entries are based on the despatch/receipt date or the invoice date.

use_sop_reverse_charge_invoice_option.description: Indicates whether to apply reverse charge VAT rules when printing invoices.

sop_print_eu_zero_rated_sales_option_id.description: The Id for the text on invoice lines for EU zero-rated sales.

invoice_payment_immediately.description: Indicates whether to invoice a payment with order immediately.

use_card_processing.description: Indicates whether card processing is enabled.

amend_header_analysis_codes.description: Indicates whether analysis codes can be changed on an order or return header.

last_invoicing_delete_run_by.description: The user that ran the last invoicing delete process.

last_invoicing_delete_run_on.description: The date the invoice delete process was last run.

invoicing_last_deleted_up_to.description: The date that the invoices were last deleted to.

use_cross_selling_items.description: Indicates whether to enable adding cross-selling items to an order.

show_frequent_items.description: Indicates whether to include frequently ordered items when looking at suggested items.

show_recent_items.description: Indicates whether to include recently ordered items when looking at suggested items.

show_preferred_items.description: Indicates whether to include preferred items when looking at suggested items.

number_of_days_for_frequent_items.description: The default number of days in which to include frequently ordered items.

minimum_number_of_lines_for_frequent_ite.description: The default minimum number of lines in which item has been ordered.

number_of_days_for_recent_items.description: The default number of days determining whether an item is included as a recent item.

sop_reverse_charge_invoice_option_type.description: The type used for the invoice/credit note text when reverse charge is applied.

sop_invoice_cis_reverse_charge_text_type.description: The type used for the text printed on invoices when CIS reverse charge is applied.

sop_credit_note_cis_reverse_charge_text_.description: The type used for the text printed on credit notes when CIS reverse charge is applied.

record_tracking_on_despatch.description: Indicates whether to record tracking information when an order is despatched.

date_time_created.description: The date and time this entity was created (UTC).

date_time_updated.description: The date and time this entity was last updated (UTC).

cash_order_account.description: The customer to be used as the cash account.

prospect_quote_account.description: The customer to be used as the prospect account for quotations.

sop_settings.description: The SOP Settings are used to choose how to process and manage your Sales Order Processing.
